text.p: Switzerland has cancelled its visa for Zaire's ailing ruler Mobutu Sese Seko after his departure this month, a foreign ministry spokesman said on Thursday.

Mobutu, who said this week that he intended returning to Lausanne for a medical check-up, left Switzerland on November 4 for the French Riviera where he has a villa. He underwent more than two months of treatment for prostate cancer in Lausanne.

Mobutu, 66, told French TF-1 television on Monday he would have a three-day check-up in Switzerland, where he has more than $4 billion in numbered bank accounts according to Swiss media, and then return to his strife-torn country.
But Swiss Foreign Ministry spokesman Jean-Philippe Tissieres said Mobutu's visa had been extended for medical treatment until November 27 on condition that he did not leave the country.
"Because of his (Mobutu's) departure, the visa has been automatically cancelled and there is no new visa demand at the moment," he said.

The spokesman declined to say whether a new visa would be granted to Mobutu, whose presence in Switzerland sparked protests from local deputies in Lausanne who appealed to the federal government to block the dictator's return.
